TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit RegexRunnerFactory extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Creates a class for a compiled regular expression.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexRunner> object executes a compiled regular expression. A regular expression that is compiled to an assembly becomes a type in that assembly, and an object of that type is typically created using reflection. However, creating an object by reflection is an expensive operation. The RegexRunnerFactory class improves the performance of the .NET Framework by providing the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexRunnerFactory.CreateInstance%2A> method, which creates a <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexRunner> object for a specific compiled regular expression.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexRunner CreateInstance() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, creates a object for a specific compiled regular expression.
Docs.returns: A object designed to execute a specific compiled regular expression.
